benchmark_details.name: LiMe: a Latin Corpus of Late Medieval Criminal Sentences
benchmark_details.overview: The LiMe dataset is a corpus of 325 documents extracted from medieval manuscripts called Libri sententiarum potestatis Mediolani, annotated for use in masked language model tasks and natural language processing applications.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a resource for researchers studying medieval law and to facilitate analysis using natural language processing techniques.

data.source: Medieval manuscripts called Libri sententiarum potestatis Mediolani from the city of Milan.
data.annotation: Annotated by domain experts with manual identification of entities, relations, and events.

methodology.calculation: Model performance was measured using F1 Score on various NLP tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Scores indicate better performance in classification tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Latin BERT achieved a weighted F1 score of 0.96 for document classification.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through expert annotation and evaluated using NLP techniques.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of gender distribution among victims and criminals.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential reinforcement of historical stereotypes if misused.
